Company Name British American Tobacco Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 54 views

Job description

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential?
An exciting opportunity has become available for a Trade Marketing Representative to join our National Field team and work across our Melbourne patches.

About The Role

In the role of Trade Marketing Representative, your typical daily activities will involve
  • Analyse and interpret store specific data
  • Engage in commercial conversations and negotiations
  • Build and foster strong business partnerships with retailers
  • Work with and support Account Managers to drive marketing strategies in key accounts
  • Educate retailers on product and category knowledge


About You

You should ideally possess the following attributes
  • you will have a Business Degree or 2-3 years’ experience in sales/marketing
  • you will have the ability to meet and exceed performance targets and execute good time and territory management
  • you will possess good organisational and administration skills in order to self-manage and develop discipline and be flexible and coachable
  • you will demonstrate customer focus with comprehensive communication skills and the ability to express yourself verbally
  • you will possess resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude’
  • you require a valid state Driver’s License and safe driving record

The Perks
If you are successful, you will receive the following
  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Fully maintained company vehicle, company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, BATA is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and value diversity at our company. If the above appeals to you, do not hesitate to apply today.

Job description

At Savills Australia you will help shape the future of the Australian property market. You will do so as a member of a property services firm with an unparalleled reputation for excellence. Globally, Savills has been introducing innovations to market and delivering exceptional service to clients for over 150 years.\xa0


A unique opportunity exists for a full time Office Manager to join our growing success and become an integral part of a vibrant working environment. Reporting to the Managing Director VIC, this diverse and challenging role requires someone who is highly professional in both presentation and communication, is exceptionally well organised, has the flexibility to respond to changing priorities, is naturally resourceful and resilient, and can build solid relationships with all members of staff.\xa0


This role offers an enormous amount of variety, the ability to work autonomously and the opportunity to utilise your skills in managing people and positively influencing the corporate culture. The role will also include a considerable amount of end to end HR.

\xa0

The key responsibilities of the role include:

\xa0

  • Provide high level executive support to the VIC MD including managing the MD’s schedule and workload, routing and drafting correspondence on behalf of the MD, client and staff liaison on behalf of the MD.
  • Manage the day to day running of the office and maintaining office efficiency
  • Recruitment and end to end HR requirements with support from National HR team
  • Assist with preparation of board meeting and senior management reports and presentations for the MD
  • Keeping up to date with all business activities and meetings
  • Coordinate all office equipment with IT department

\xa0

The successful candidate will have:

\xa0

  • Minimum of 3-5 years in a similar senior position
  • HR or recruitment experience essential
  • Advanced skills within the Microsoft Office suite with fast, accurate word processing skills
  • Exceptional organisational skills and time management skills
  • Demonstrate a strong eye for detail and accuracy
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills

\xa0

If property is your passion, Savills is all about the people behind the property. Sound like you?

839161472:
[

UX Designer

Company Name RMIT Online Company Location 235-251 Bourke Street Building 108, Level 4, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 137 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Not your average university – who is RMIT Online?\xa0


RMIT Online, a subsidiary of RMIT University is an exciting ‘startup’ team dedicated to building a “Community of lifelong learners, successfully navigating the world of work”. We’re small, nimble, fast-paced and working on really exciting futuristic things.


We were created to leverage disruptive innovation in the higher education sector in key local and international markets. With student experience at the forefront of our design, we strive to build world-class online learning experiences with our leading industry partners. And we have a bit of fun along the way.


Sounds great! Tell me about the role?


Working in a close-knit team, you’ll play a key role in defining, crafting and improving our existing learning products and environments whilst ensuring we provide our students with amazing learning experiences.


From the get-go, you’ll be brainstorming, researching, designing and refining learning experiences within specified product requirements and deadlines. You’ll also be creating project briefs, presentations, user flows, user journeys, taxonomies and other documentation to communicate recommended user experiences of our learning environment to internal stakeholders.


To do this, you’ll collect and produce information from all over the place to make informed decisions and design recommendations for our existing learning products and platforms and how we can improve them. You will also present design concepts clearly and persuasively to the Design, Technology and other project teams, as well as executive leadership and project stakeholders for review and to gather feedback.


Collaboration is key, so, the more you can understand our learners and tutors’ needs and refine design approaches, and validate solutions, the more you’ll shine! You’ll also work closely within an agile a cross-functional team that includes learning designers, researchers, UX designers, visual designers, product managers, technology engineers, business owners and subject matter experts.


Let’s talk about you


Collaborative, engaging, strategic and with a fantastic sense of humour, you’re passionate about keeping up up-to-date with the latest UX trends, techniques, and technologies.


You’re a mid-weight UX designer with an impressive background in UI or UX and solid talent in Adobe CC, you’ll be able to present an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating relevant experience. Previous experience creating prototypes on software platforms like Axure, Invision, Flinto will be essential to support your success.


You know how to things done well. You’ll be strategising with the Design Team and product managers to take action on research findings. With outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, you’re a star at liaising, influencing and negotiating with a range of people to achieve agreed outcomes.


You’re passionate about building digital experiences and promoting user-centred design which will help you establish robust research and design processes. You have some incredible knowledge and experience behind you, so you know how to creatively inspire others to achieve exciting results.


Ticking your boxes?


Send us your resume and a brief cover letter\xa0telling us about:


  • Why does UX matter?
  • What you believe the future of online education might be?
  • What excites you about RMIT Online?


Need more convincing?


You’ll be stepping into our brand-new offices in the heart of the CBD, surrounded by a beautifully buzzing team of high achievers who are passionate, friendly and non-boring types.


Some of our benefits include breakfast daily, professional development opportunities, casual dress code, lots of social activities including Friday night drinks, monthly birthday cakes, and more!


You can read more about us here: https://learn.rmitonline.edu.au/



RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.

839220684:
[

Clinical Safety Physician

Company Name CSL Company Location 45 Poplar Rd, Melbourne, VIC 3052, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 31 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity:


The Clinical Safety Physician provides guidance and expertise on all aspects of –clinical safety throughout the entire lifecycle of a product with special emphasis on ongoing evaluation of safety information during clinical development and state of the art pharmacovigilance post approval. Apply sound medical judgment for analysis and interpretation of complex clinical safety data for signal detection and initiation of safety risk management activities including safety specification, PV planning and risk minimization/mitigation. Integrate safety risk management activities of the product into their medical, business and regulatory context.


Duties Include:


  • Lead active monitoring and continued assessment of safety profile through systematic signal detection and critical review of aggregate safety data and literature during all phases of the life-cycle of a defined portfolio of medicinal products.
  • Guide the clinical development teams regarding all aspects of clinical safety, including trial design, appropriateness of safety endpoints, analysis and interpretation of safety data.
  • Liaise with KOLs, set up and coordinate Advisory Boards and Drug Safety Monitoring Boards. \xa0Be accountable for timely delivery of all safety deliverables towards Clinical Study Reports, preparations for market applications and all other regulatory documents.
  • Lead multidisciplinary teams (e.g. Safety Management Teams) regarding safety relevant topics and escalate all safety relevant matters to the appropriate decision making level with proposals for solutions based on analysis of the available information.
  • Act as safety expert providing strategic input to key stake holders in relation to product safety, understand the business strategy for the product and be knowledgeable about the (medical) context of the respective product class.
  • Be the accountable content owner for all safety relevant content or safety relevant safety documents during clinical development (e.g. DSUR, Development Risk Management Plans, Safety Analysis Plans) and post approval (e.g. PSUR, RMPs, medical expert statements and answers to HAs requests). \xa0Be content owner for safety relevant communications such as DHCP letters and company statements.
  • Perform investigation into safety profile of potential new product acquisitions (due diligence processes) and ensure that all necessary requirements are included in PV agreements, and also act as safety liaison to license partners.
  • Participate actively in the Continuous Improvement Process (CIP) targeted at continuous improvements of quality of processes, methods and communication.
  • Review and contribute to safety relevant SOP and improvement of safety relevant SOPs.
  • Develop and update of safety relevant chapters of the CCSI/DCSC including frequency tables for ADRs and justification documents for new safety information.
  • Interface with other departments (e.g. clinical development, regulatory, health economics, pharmaco-epidemiology, medical affairs) with regard to safety aspects.
  • Be subject matter expert for safety relevant discussions with regulatory agencies and other significant external bodies.
  • Provide expert advice (expert witness as required) to legal counsel regarding safety issues, as well as safety expertise to project teams
  • Contribute to clinical safety risk management relevant training and mentoring.
  • Analyze and prepare safety data for manuscript and/or publication submissions.
  • Contribute to quality improvement: Review, prepare, and/or update local and global SOPs and working instructions as required.


To Be Successful You Require:


Education:

  • Physician (MD or equivalent)

Experience:

  • Minimum of 2, preferred 5 years pharmacovigilance and / or clinical research / clinical safety experience in the pharmaceutical environment (industry, CRO).
  • Medical practice of at least 2 years, preferred is a specialization in a relevant medical area including medical practice

Competencies:

  • Sound clinical acumen and a wide range of therapeutic area knowledge.
  • Good scientific skills – able to understand scientific methods and think scientifically.
  • Ability to synthesize and analyze safety data from various sources.
  • Proficiency in problem-solving within a highly complex environment.
  • Strong communicator with excellent English language skills, both written and spoken, ideally with demonstrable experience in medical / scientific writing. Convincing argumentation and negotiating skills.
  • Good networking and team skills for successful cooperation with internal and external customers.

Of advantage:

  • Expertise in international regulations governing drug safety.
  • Knowledge of clinical research methodology, clinical epidemiology/biostatistics , pharmacovigilance tools and processes and relevant regulatory framework.
  • Experience in managing compliance or audits.
  • Specialization in a medical therapeutic area relevant for the \xa0CSL portfolio.

\xa0

\xa0

How to Apply:

Applications must address the selection criteria above and include a current CV and covering letter.


Employment screening, including criminal history, medical assessment, confirmation of experience and stated qualifications, Australian working rights and other relevant checks form part of the candidate suitability

\xa0

Sales Representative - Melbourne Outter North

Company Name GSK Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 83 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Your Responsibilities

We are looking for a Field Sales Representative to join our high performing sales team. This role services the Melbourne North and also Bendigo as a country territory and forms part of our high profile and market leading respiratory therapeutic area with a focus on asthma and COPD.

Reporting into a First Line Sales Manager you will play a critical role in engaging with primary care health professionals to promote our respiratory portfolio.

The key to our success is recognising the value each of our Sales Representatives brings to the broader team, ensuring we remain connected and supportive of each other. You will be part of a highly-motivated sales team focused on making a real and meaningful difference to deliver positive patient outcomes.

About The Role
  • Identify, build and develop relationships with GPs;
  • Develop and execute a comprehensive territory plan and deliver on brand strategy;
  • Support the implementation of key programs which differentiate and enhance GSK’s standing in the healthcare market;
  • Provide a science led and value-added service for customers that supports best treatment outcomes for patients;
  • Work in partnership with GSK Hospital Specialist Representatives, commercial and medical teams to deliver objectives in line with GSK strategic goals.
About You
  • Experience in a field Sales Representative role/s within a large, multi- layered global organisation;
  • Tenacious, agile learner, drive for results, resilient and able to work autonomously;
  • Clear and influential communication skills;
  • An aptitude for science with the ability to relay complex information in a clear and tailored format;
  • A sharp commercial focus complemented by outstanding sales, influencing and relationship-building skills;
  • A team orientated approach.
Ideally, we are looking for an experienced pharmaceutical sales professional with strong commercial acumen and a desire to make a difference. This role represents a great chance to showcase your sales aptitude in a fast paced and varied environment and be part of a global business that is focussed and committed to helping people to feel better, do more and live longer.

If you are looking for #careerswithpurpose please click on the link below to apply now.

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.

Why You?
Field Sales Experience


Bachelors degree science/business or similar

Why GSK?
GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) is a science-led healthcare company, with a proud history in Australia dating back to 1886. Our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer.

Contact information
You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Trusts, Foundations and Government Account Manager

Company Name Australian Red Cross Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 53 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Full time position
  • Ongoing role
  • Flexible location - Melbourne or Sydney

Who we are


Australian Red Cross is part of the world’s largest humanitarian organisation. Our aim is to improve the lives of the most vulnerable people in Australia and across our region.


About the role


The role is positioned within Red Cross’ Business Development Unit, with the focus being the securing of financial support for Red Cross programs and services through both government sources and philanthropic trusts and foundations.\xa0


Primary responsibilities will include collaborating closely with key internal stakeholders, identifying funding opportunities and leading the development of high quality tenders, grant applications, and other funding proposals/pitches.\xa0


The ideal candidate will enjoy forming and strengthening collaborative working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, will have a strong track record of achieving both financial and non-financial targets, and a strong understanding of government funding processes and/or the philanthropic sector.


What you will bring


  • Strong relationship management skills across all levels. \xa0
  • Proven ability to drive and achieve financial targets.
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, with a flexible, positive and collaborative approach.
  • Highly developed writing skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and experience in writing persuasively and with influence.
  • Solid experience in the development of tenders/funding submissions to trusts, foundations and/or government.
  • High level analytical and research skills including the ability to analyse data and evidence and apply the findings as appropriate.

Benefits

Be part of one of the largest humanitarian organisations and know that the work that you do will help improve outcomes for vulnerable people. Red Cross offers generous salary packaging benefits and flexible working arrangements.


For further enquiries please contact David Macdermott on 03 9341 7520
